If you want to talk to us about how we can help you transform your customer experience, or ask about our latest technology, you can reach us on the form below and someone will be in touch as soon as possible! We would also be delighted to welcome you to our office to meet the team and show you round our products on display in our showroom. Beer  List Event Venue We have expanded our patio to include a two story open air pavilion and an adjacent courtyard. Located right off the Pinellas Trail in beautiful Downtown Dunedin. This space give you so much room and options to really let your creativity come out for your wedding or special event. The second floor loft contains a bar and can be accessed from two separate staircases.Ample downtown parking with a free parking garage located right next door. Book It Beers We update our beer list often. Be sure to check out whats on tap. Whats on tap Upcoming Public Events Its never a dull moment here at HOB. From Craft Beer Festivals to Silent Disco, we know how to throw a proper party. Check out our upcoming event schedule so you don’t miss it! Click Here Subscribe to Our Newsletter Sign up with your email address to receive news and updates. Email Address Sign Up Thank you! Must be 21 to be served Artists scheduled to appear are subject to change without notice

About Us - Mt. Hood Brewing Co. Home About Us Beer Menus Govy Menu Rainbow Tavern Menu PDX Menu Tilikum Private Events MT. HOOD BREWING CO. EST. 1991 ABOUT MT. HOOD BREWING CO. The Mt. Hood Brewing Co. opened in January 1991 in the alpine village of Government Camp, Oregon, serving locally-produced beers and hearty pub fare in a family-friendly atmosphere. It is owned by R.L.K. and Company, the same folks who have been operating historic Timberline Lodge since 1955. In October 1992, the newly constructed ten barrel brewery rolled out its first barrel under the watchful eye of Brewmaster Jon B. Graber. The Mt. Hood Brewing Co. is named for a brewery that originally operated in Portland, Oregon from 1905 to 1913 during the pre-prohibition heyday of American brewers. In 2018, construction began on a brewery expansion, adjacent to the existing brewery and brewpub in Government Camp. With the addition of two fermentation tanks, brite beer tanks, dry and cold storage, Mt. Hood Brewing Co. has doubled production. Cold and packaged beer storage plus a new packaging area has enabled us to offer a greater variety of seasonal ales in bottle, including barrel-aged beers, and more canned craft beers utilizing a new canning line. The Mt. Hood Brewing Co. was founded upon the notion that beer is best produced in small, handcrafted batches utilizing the finest ingredients. The brewery’s commitment to this standard demands that each keg arrives at its destination while in its prime – fresh and wholesome. Thus, none of the beer leaves the State of Oregon. Our beers can be enjoyed at our brewpub in Government Camp and throughout Timberline Lodge on Mt. Hood. With the additions of Mt. Hood Brewing Co. Tilikum Station (Portland) in 2018 and Mt. Hood Brewing Co. Rainbow Tavern (Maupin) in 2022, you can find our craft ales farther afield. Draft and packaged beers are also available in several local restaurants and shops. OUR BREWER R.L.K. and Company, operators of Mt. Hood Brewing Co. and Timberline Lodge , appointed Bryan Borgmeier as Head Brewer of the Mt. Hood Brewing Co. in fall 2016. Bryan grew up in Oregon City, and completed his Bachelor of Science Degree in Economics from Linfield College in McMinnville, OR. It was at a Linfield class on homebrewing that he was introduced to the magic of brewing beer. He earned an Associate Degree in Brewing Technology from Siebel Institute of Technology in 2014. Over the course of the last several years, Bryan has traveled through Oregon and the Lake Tahoe area of California, gaining valuable experience at several reputable breweries. “Mt. Hood is an icon, as is Timberline, and to be able to represent this icon as a brewer is an amazing opportunity,” states Bryan, “In addition to updating the core lineup of beers, I’d like to develop special projects, maybe 3-4 caged bottles that we release every year. And of course I’d like to make a fresh hop beer and continue to work on the barrel-aged beer program that Timberline Chef Jason Stoller Smith helped start. I think that Mt. Hood, the brand, being an icon, has a ton of potential that most don’t have. A rare opportunity. In the NW we’re blessed with really fresh hop yards, malting facilities, a world-class yeast lab. And of course we have a glacier-fed well of pure, pristine and plentiful water.” ~Brewer Bryan Borgmeier MT. HOOD BREWING CO. Govy 87304 E Gov. Camp Loop Government Camp, OR 97028 503-272-3172 Email Lost and found OPEN DAILY 11:00am to 9:00pm FOLLOW US! Oregon law prohibits all animals except for service animals in restaurants. Mt. Hood Brewing Co. is part of R.L.K. and Company, which includes Timberline and Chevron in Government Camp SEARCH JOBS PRIVACY POLICY SUBSCRIBE TO OUR EMAIL LIST MT. HOOD BREWING CO. Tilikum Station 401 SE Caruthers St. Portland, OR 97214 971-302-7296 Email OPEN DAILY 11:00am to 8:00pm MT. HOOD BREWING CO. Rainbow Tavern 411 Deschutes Ave. Maupin, OR 97037 541-395-2497 Email OPEN DAILY 11:00am to 11:00pm til midnight Fridays & Saturdays Copyright © 2018 Mt. Hood Brewing Co. All rights reserved.

Learn More 765 Route 16 Ossipee, NH 03864 Thursday 12pm - 9pm Friday & Saturday 12pm - 8pm Sunday 12pm - 5pm Tap List Hobbs Brew Barge in Belize Full-service floating restaurant serving American comfort classics, tropical cocktails, and Hobbs Brewing Company, Belize beers - The Craft Beer of Belize! Learn More Mile 21 Placencia Rd Punta Placencia, Belize About us Just making better beer every day Award-winning beer, and immersive experiences, since 2014. The modern yet rustic Hobbs Tavern opened in April 2014, with three business partners driving the complete renovation of the building and the creation of a new restaurant. On-site beer production for the brewpub also began in 2014, with Hobbs procuring a canning line and starting packaging and self-distribution in 2016. That same year, the Hobbs Team won a Bronze medal at the Great International Beer Festival for their “One Arm Farmhouse Ale.” In 2017, that same beer won silver. Continuing the tradition of “just making better beer every day,” the brewery began to outgrow its humble beginnings and made plans to expand. In the fall of 2018, building and equipment installation for the relocation of the production and canning operations to a new 9,000 sq./ft production facility began, located 11.1 miles down RT 16. The new space features a 15 BBL brewhouse and the capacity to produce 15,000 barrels of beer. On October 31, 2020, the Tap Room opened to the public, marking a significant milestone in Hobbs Tavern's journey. View Event → Sep 22 Paint Your Pal - Paint Pawty Monday, September 22, 2025 6:00 PM 10:30 PM Google Calendar ICS Join us at HOB Brewing Co. on Monday, September 22nd at 6 PM for a fun-filled night of painting and celebrating your beloved companion! Whether you’re a seasoned artist or just want to try something new, this event is all about creativity, community, and giving back. What to Expect: Paint a portrait of your beloved companion in a relaxed, supportive atmosphere on a pre-sketched 11”x14” canvas. Connect with fellow animal lovers over drinks and creativity. Add an extra special touch with an enhanced ticket—I’ll pre-paint your pal’s eyes and nose for an additional $15! 30% of each ticket supports Humane Social of Pinellas and Compassion Kind, helping animals in need. Take home a special treat for your pup from Marcy’s Pet Kitchen. Ticket Info: Standard Tickets : $50 per person, Enhanced Tickets : $65 per person Tickets must be purchased by August 2nd to secure your spot. Tickets can be purchased HERE ! Attendees must be 21 or older. Ready to honor your furry friend with a one-of-a-kind painting? Grab your spot now, invite your friends, and let’s create something special together! ** Cancellation Policy : Full refund if canceled 48 hours in advance; partial refund after that. After you purchase your ticket, I’ll send you an email from hello@sketchbookbykristen.com to request your fur baby’s photo and name, and your background color selection. View Event → Apr 5 Live Music - 8 Ball Aitken Saturday, April 5, 2025 7:30 PM 10:30 PM Google Calendar ICS 8 Ball Aitken has toured the world for more than a decade performing his swampy-blues-rock across twenty countries to date. He’s earned a loyal fanbase from his live shows and internet videos, while paying his dues as a singer, songwriter, slide-guitarist, and producer. 8 Ball moved to Nashville, Tennessee, USA in 2012 and worked for nine years with many of the best in the blues business today. He won second place in the 2021 International New Orleans Cigar Box Guitar Festival hosted by blues woman Samantha Fish. 8 Ball is back with a brand-new blues rock album ‘ICE CREAM MAN 2’ that hit #1 in the Australian Blues & Roots Charts in June 2023 and had 4 number #1 AMRAP Chart hits. This new 12-song recording was mostly completed in Nashville right before he re-located back to Australia. It’s a highly anticipated follow up to the first ‘ICE CREAM MAN’ album that also hit #1 on the Australian Blues & Roots Charts in March 2021. 8 Ball Aitken produced ‘ICE CREAM MAN 2’ himself. The cast of musicians include Grammy winning drummer Tom Hambridge (Buddy Guy), saxophone legend Buddy Leach (George Thorogood & The Destroyers), Sydney soul singer Taya Chani and 8 Ball’s younger brother Dillion James Aitken on Hammond organ and piano. 8 Ball’s partner Jessy Lynch also sang backup vocals. Jessy & 8 Ball welcomed their new baby boy ‘Sonny Miles Aitken’ into their musical family earlier this year.
